main event: A bright orange object, described as a 'streamlined egg-shape', was sighted hovering over Woburn, Massachusetts on November 8, 1962.
interesting points: The object had a black band near the lower edge and a projection or protrusion on it.

The witness, Charles F. Kirk Jr., said the object reflected a bluish-green light and was estimated to be about 10 feet long, 20 feet wide, and 15 feet in height, though he noted the exact size was much larger.
Kirk, a machinist and carpenter, was working on a new building when he noticed the strange object, which hovered for several minutes between 6 and 6:10 pm.
Kirk described feeling a 'weird feeling' of being watched while observing the object.
According to the local news, the same or a similar object was seen by others in the area.
sighted object: a bright orange, streamlined egg-shaped object
witnesses: Charles F. Kirk Jr., a machinist and carpenter
photographs: yes, the report includes a photograph of the object
